intro: Acourtia pinetorum, commonly known as the pine mountain dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and basal rosette of leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Acourtia pinetorum has small, hairy leaves and produces a capsule-like fruit that contains numerous seeds. It is a herbaceous perennial that thrives in full sun and is adapted to arid environments.
